intro: Castilla australis, commonly known as the Chilean firetree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant features a tall, tree-like structure with thick, woody stems and large, palmate leaves. It thrives in coastal areas and is well adapted to saline and arid conditions. Castilla australis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
